title: Add iterator.step and a predicate overload for iterator.take
body:
- Add a predicate overload for iterator.take
- Add iterator.step
- Improve the error message when using a lookup as an import item

title: Error improvements
body: This PR starts cleaning up the various error types in the Koto crates to standardize on using error kind enums with `thiserror`.

title: Rename the core runtime types
body:
This PR renames the core runtime value types to follow a more consistent naming
pattern, making use of a `K` prefix to help with disambiguation.

title: Color lib improvements
body:
- Update to the latest version of the palette crate
- Add a mix function for colors
- Add hsl/hsv color constructors

title: CLI Improvements
body:
- Replace REPL implementation with Rustyline
- Disable colored REPL output when the NO_COLOR env var is set
  - Fixes #104
- Enable VI style editing in the repl
- Add support for loading a config file for the REPL

title: API Improvements
body:
- Reorder the Koto interface and add some extra docs
- Move the 1+2 test into the Koto docs
- Extract Error and Result types for the Koto crate
- Rename Koto::run_function_by_name -> run_exported_function
- Add a Koto::compile_and_run convenience function

title: Link to the website
body:
- Update the readme
- Link to the website from the language guide intro
- Update the homepage URL in each manifest

title: Various cleanups
body:
- Switch to 'latest stable' for the MSRV
- Break out the instruction enum into its own file
- Update to the latest version of chrono
- Run cargo update
- Update to indexmap 2.0.0
- Update to criterion 0.5.1

title: Remove 'assume valid bytecode' logic
body:
- Fix the N-body benchmark, and use --all-targets instead of --workspace
- Remove the 'assume valid bytecode' paths

title: import/export improvements
body:
This PR makes a couple of improvements to importing and exporting values: 
- `import` expression syntax has been simplified to disallow importing nested items directly.
- `export` expressions now accept map literals to simplify exporting multiple items from a module.

title: Use variable-sized integers in bytecode ops
body: This PR allows for the removal of various ops that deal with fixed-sized integers by making use of variable-sized integers.

title: Value size reduction - part two
body: Following on from #236, this PR completes the effort to reduce the overall size of the `Value` enum to 24 bytes.

title: Value size reduction - part one
body:
This is the first part of an overall effort to reduce the size of `Value` from 40 to 24 bytes. 

To make this possible all variants need to be brought down to 16 bytes. 

After this PR the function variants are still larger than 16 bytes, and will be dealt with in a following PR.

title: Runtime cleanups
body:
- Replace Value::StringBuilder with a stack of builders in the VM
- Replace Value::StringBuilder with a stack of builders in the VM
- Rename Vm::value_stack -> registers and add missing comments to the VM fields
- Resolve a couple of TODOs
- Remove the RuntimeResult type alias
- Remove the InstructionResult type alias
- Reorganize the runtime src files
- Inline Frame into vm.rs
- Define the Koto prelude in CoreLib
- Collect io related files in a module

title: Display improvements
body:
- Avoid recursive display of Lists and Maps
- Remove KotoDisplay and replace StringBuilder with DisplayContext
- Remove the Debug impl for Koto values
- Remove KotoCopyable

title: Switch to using the `crate` import granularity style
body:
Koto's been using the `one` import granularity style [1], but this doesn't play well with Rust Analyzer [2] which has made me wish for a change, and the `crate` style seems like a decent alternative.

[1] https://rust-lang.github.io/rustfmt/?search=#imports_granularity
[2] https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-analyzer/issues/11361

title: Fix arithmetic assignment ops in the REPL
body: Fixes #230

title: Introduce trait-based objects
body:
This PR replaces the `ExternalValue` concept with objects built using the `KotoObject` trait.

This is a significant simplification for declaring custom object types, and allows for optimizations that weren't possible with the `MetaMap` approach.

title: Cached iterator adaptors
body: This PR makes the behaviour of `iterator.chunks`, `cycle`, and `windows` more predictable when adapting generators or stateful iterators like `peekable` by caching initial iterator output.

title: Introduce iterator.peekable()
body: This PR introduces `iterator.peekable`

title: Support for custom iterators
body:
This PR adds support for custom iterators via `@next`/`@next_back` meta keys.

- Remove the repeatability requirement for iterator.windows()/chunks()
- Guard against recursive operations overflowing the register stack
- Introduce @next/@next_back meta keys
- Add external value support for @next/@next_back
- Introduce iterator.next_back

title: More tweaks
body:
- Fix using an assignment's LHS in match expressions
- Fix using an assignment's LHS in switch expressions
- Add bidirectional support to iterator.each

title: Miscellaneous tweaks
body:
- Remove list.with_size
- Add missing docs for iterator.reversed
- Fix capturing when declaring maps with implicit values

title: Iterator improvements
body:
- Unpack for loop arguments via iteration instead of indexing
- Iterators should set the result register to null when exhausted

title: Improve span placement for assignment errors
Fix assignment from switch/match expressions without else branches
body:
- Use Null as the default value in switch expressions
- Use Null as the default value in match expressions

title: Disallow using unbounded ranges as iterators
Avoid assigned values being replaced with iterators during unpacking
Introduce wrapped `Ptr`/`PtrMut` types
body:
- Rename RcCell -> PtrMut and move it to a new koto_memory crate
- Introduce an immutable pointer type to koto_memory and use it in ValueTuple
- Make use of PtrMut in ValueIterator
- Make use of Ptr in ConstantPool and ValueString
- Place bytecode chunks in Ptr

title: More External Value improvements
body:
- Merge the copy/deep_copy functions into the koto module
- Introduce an RcCell<T> wrapper for Rc<RefCell<T>>
- Add copy/deep_copy support for external values
- Rename ExternalValue -> External
- Unify the various builder helpers with .function()/.function_aliased()

title: Rename external_value_fn to value_fn
body:
- Rename external_value_fn to value_fn
- Use value_fn where appropriate in external value ops

title: Range improvements
body:
- Preserve Range flavour in IntRange and remove IndexRange
- Add range.is_inclusive
- Add range.intersection

title: Fix execution error when capturing values
body:
- Capture stdout of runtime tests so debug expressions can be used
- Fix implicit return after previous conditional return
- Ensure temporary registers are truncated correctly when calling a function

title: Add support for unpacking iterables
body:
This PR changes value unpacking in assignments to work via iteration instead of indexing.

Additionally, external values get support for implementing @iterator.

title: Object Improvements
body:
This PR introduces some substantial changes to the way Maps with Metamaps behave in Koto.

- Disable map module fallback for maps containing metamaps
- Introduce `@base` metakey
- Make `self` an implicit argument rather than explicit

title: Miscellaneous Tweaks
body:
- Make color/geometry types public
- Add tuple converters for lib types
- Remove old to_num4 reference in the docs
- Add highlighting to the repl examples in getting_started.md
- Fix the argument ordering in the Color initializers
- Support unpacking values that implement @[]
- Add Vec2.angle
- Add indexing support to Vec2, Vec3, and Color
- Add extra Vec2/Vec3 initializers
- Remove unused MetaKey Display impl

title: Improve error messages when unpacking args with the wrong size
Allow tuples to be used as map keys, introduce koto.hash
body:
- Rename Value::is_immutable -> is_hashable
- Implement TryFrom instead of From for Value -> ValueKey conversions
- Simplify ValueKey and allow Tuples to used as map keys
- Add koto.hash

title: Introduce the KotoDisplay trait and remove fmt::Display impl for Value
body: Fixes #203.

title: Remove packed number types (Num2 / Num4)
body:
This PR introduces the `color` and `geometry` libraries, and removes the `Num2` and `Num4` types.

Fixes #201 and #202.

title: Update dependencies
body:
- Use workspace dependencies
- Update jemallocator and use it by default in CLI release builds
- Update some dependencies
- Update the just wasm command to run tests

title: Add more types of tests
body:
- Add tests that check running scripts via the CLI
- Ensure that the code example in the readme can be run
- Refresh the wasm example dependencies, and run wasm tests on CI
  - This fixes #132.

title: Add support for function objects
body: This PR adds support for overloading function calls with the `@||` meta key.

title: Return ValueStrings from KotoFile functions
body: Fixes #191.

title: Introduce SmallInt AST node and SetNumberNegU8 bytecode op
body: `SetNumberU8` already exists for arg unpacking, it can be used for all positive u8 values, and with `SetNumberNegU8` now all integers in the `-255..=255` range can be compiled without stored constants.

title: Simplify implementation of modify-assignment operations
body: Following on from #193, this PR simplifies the implementation of modify-assignment operations by making it so that the result of the operation is always the LHS.

title: Arithmetic assignment operator improvements
body:
- Implement modify-assignments using specific bytecode ops
- Allow assignment operators to be overridden in metamaps

title: Docs and API tweaks
body:
- Remove data_fn_2 helpers from MetaMapBuilder
- Simplify the one_plus_two example
- Remove DataMap::new() in favour of DataMap::default()
- Add missing docs, enable #[warn(missing_docs)] in all remaining crates
- Remove some unnecessary functions from DataMap and ValueMap

title: API improvement followups
body: This PR adds a couple of changes that were missing from #187.

title: API improvements
body: This PR includes a collection of improvements to Koto's API, in particular it introduces `MetaMapBuilder` which makes is easier to define `MetaMaps`, and a prelude for commonly imported types.

title: Update to Rust 1.65
body:
- Listen to clippy
- Make use of let..else blocks
- Make use of io::read_to_string
